thread.title: Macklemore set to play the Renaissance Coliseum in February
thread.title_full: Macklemore set to play the Renaissance Coliseum in February

author: Thomas Bruch
title: Macklemore set to play the Renaissance Coliseum in February
text: Macklemore set to play the Renaissance Coliseum in February Comment Posted Oct. 12, 2015 at 12:14 PM Updated at 2:11 PM Posted Oct. 12, 2015 at 12:14 PM Updated at 2:11 PM PEORIA â€” Grammy Award winning artist Macklemore and his sidekick, Ryan Lewis, will perform at the Renaissance Coliseum at Bradley University on Feb. 4. Tickets go on sale at 8:30 a.m. Wednesday for Bradley students only at the Coliseum ticket office. Tickets for students cost $11 through Nov. 3 and $16 after. The pit in front of the stage will be open only to current Bradley students. Tickets will go on sale to public for $36 at 8:30 a.m. Oct. 21 online and at any Ticketmaster location. Bradley faculty and staff can purchase tickets beginning Oct. 19. Macklemore and Ryan Lewis won multiple Grammy Awards on their debut album, "The Heist," most notably for the hit song "Thrift Shop." Macklemore's follow-up album is forthcoming and the single off that album, "Downtown," has once again dominated pop charts and radio airwaves. The opening act for the show will be announced at a later date. Doors to the Coliseum will open at 7 p.m. Feb. 4 with the show starting at 8:30 p.m. Students will not be allowed entry to the show without a valid student ID.
